intro: Kogelbergia phylicoides, commonly known as the Cape hybrid heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, leathery berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Kogelbergia phylicoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to thrive in coastal and Mediterranean climates.
